verses.verse: Now <WG1161> all <WG3956> the tax-gatherers and the sinners <WG268> were coming <WG1448> near <WG1448> Him to listen <WG191> to Him.

And both <WG5037> the Pharisees <WG5330> and the scribes <WG1122> [began] to grumble, <WG1234> saying, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> man <WG3778> receives <WG4327> sinners <WG268> and eats <WG4906> with them."
And He told <WG3004> them this <WG3778> parable, <WG3850> saying, <WG3004>

"What <WG5101> man <WG444> among <WG1537> you, if he has <WG2192> a hundred <WG1540> sheep <WG4263> and has lost <WG622> one <WG1520> of them, does not leave <WG2641> the ninety-nine in the open <WG2048> pasture, <WG2048> and go <WG4198> after <WG1909> the one which is lost, <WG622> until <WG2193> he finds <WG2147> it?
"And when he has found <WG2147> it, he lays <WG2007> it on his shoulders, <WG5606> rejoicing. <WG5463>

"And when he comes <WG2064> home, <WG3624> he calls <WG4779> together <WG4779> his friends <WG5384> and his neighbors, <WG1069> saying <WG3004> to them, 'Rejoice <WG4796> with me, for I have found <WG2147> my sheep <WG4263> which was lost! <WG622>'

"I tell <WG3004> you that in the same <WG3779> way, <WG3779> there will be [more] joy <WG5479> in heaven <WG3772> over <WG1909> one <WG1520> sinner <WG268> who repents, <WG3340> than <WG2228> over <WG1909> ninety-nine righteous <WG1342> persons <WG1342> who <WG3748> need <WG5532> no <WG3756> repentance. <WG3341>

"Or <WG2228> what <WG5101> woman, <WG1135> if <WG1437> she has <WG2192> ten <WG1176> silver <WG1406> coins <WG1406> and loses <WG622> one <WG1520> coin, <WG1406> does not light <WG681> a lamp <WG3088> and sweep <WG4563> the house <WG3614> and search <WG2212> carefully <WG1960> until <WG2193> she finds <WG2147> it?

"And when she has found <WG2147> it, she calls <WG4779> together <WG4779> her friends <WG5384> and neighbors, <WG1069> saying, <WG3004> 'Rejoice <WG4796> with me, for I have found <WG2147> the coin <WG1406> which <WG3739> I had lost! <WG622>'

"In the same <WG3779> way, <WG3779> I tell <WG3004> you, there is joy <WG5479> in the presence <WG1799> of the angels <WG32> of God <WG2316> over <WG1909> one <WG1520> sinner <WG268> who repents. <WG3340>"
And He said, <WG3004> "A certain <WG5100> man <WG444> had <WG2192> two <WG1417> sons; <WG5207>

and the younger <WG3501> of them said <WG3004> to his father, <WG3962> 'Father, <WG3962> give <WG1325> me the share <WG3313> of the estate <WG3776> that falls <WG1911> to me.' And he divided <WG1244> his wealth <WG979> between <WG1244> them.

"And not many <WG4183> days <WG2250> later, <WG3326> the younger <WG3501> son <WG5207> gathered <WG4863> everything <WG3956> together <WG4863> and went <WG589> on a journey <WG589> into a distant <WG3117> country, <WG5561> and there <WG1563> he squandered <WG1287> his estate <WG3776> with loose <WG811> living. <WG2198>
"Now <WG1161> when he had spent <WG1159> everything, <WG3956> a severe <WG2478> famine <WG3042> occurred <WG1096> in that country, <WG5561> and he began <WG757> to be in need. <WG5302>
"And he went <WG4198> and attached <WG2853> himself to one <WG1520> of the citizens <WG4177> of that country, <WG5561> and he sent <WG3992> him into his fields <WG68> to feed <WG1006> swine. <WG5519>

"And he was longing <WG1937> to fill <WG1072> his stomach <WG2836> with the pods <WG2769> that the swine <WG5519> were eating, <WG2068> and no <WG3762> one <WG3762> was giving <WG1325> [anything] to him.

"But when he came <WG2064> to his senses, <WG1438> he said, <WG5346> 'How <WG4214> many <WG4214> of my father's hired <WG3407> men <WG3407> have <WG4052> more <WG4052> than <WG4052> enough <WG4052> bread, <WG740> but I am dying <WG622> here <WG5602> with hunger! <WG3042>
'I will get <WG450> up and go <WG4198> to my father, <WG3962> and will say <WG3004> to him, "Father, <WG3962> I have sinned <WG264> against <WG1519> heaven, <WG3772> and in your sight; <WG1799>
I am <WG1510> no <WG3765> longer <WG3765> worthy <WG514> to be called <WG2564> your son; <WG5207> make <WG4160> me as one <WG1520> of your hired <WG3407> men. <WG3407> "'

"And he got <WG450> up and came <WG2064> to his father. <WG3962> But while he was still <WG2089> a long <WG3112> way <WG3112> off, <WG568> his father <WG3962> saw <WG3708> him, and felt <WG4697> compassion <WG4697> [for him,] and ran <WG5143> and embraced <WG1968> <WG1909> <WG5137> him, and kissed <WG2705> him.

"And the son <WG5207> said <WG3004> to him, 'Father, <WG3962> I have sinned <WG264> against <WG1519> heaven <WG3772> and in your sight; <WG1799> I am <WG1510> no <WG3765> longer <WG3765> worthy <WG514> to be called <WG2564> your son. <WG5207>'

"But the father <WG3962> said <WG3004> to his slaves, <WG1401> 'Quickly <WG5035> bring <WG1627> out the best <WG4413> robe <WG4749> and put <WG1746> it on him, and put <WG1325> a ring <WG1146> on his hand <WG5495> and sandals <WG5266> on his feet; <WG4228>
and bring <WG5342> the fattened <WG4618> calf, <WG3448> kill <WG2380> it, and let us eat <WG2068> and be merry; <WG2165>

for this <WG3778> son <WG5207> of mine <WG1473> was dead, <WG3498> and has come <WG326> to life <WG326> again; <WG326> he was lost, <WG622> and has been found. <WG2147>' And they began <WG757> to be merry. <WG2165>

"Now <WG1161> his older <WG4245> son <WG5207> was in the field, <WG68> and when <WG5613> he came <WG2064> and approached <WG1448> the house, <WG3614> he heard <WG191> music <WG4858> and dancing. <WG5525>
"And he summoned <WG4341> one <WG1520> of the servants <WG3816> and [began] inquiring <WG4441> what <WG5101> <WG302> these <WG3778> things <WG3778> might be.

"And he said <WG3004> to him, 'Your brother <WG80> has <WG2240> come, <WG2240> and your father <WG3962> has killed <WG2380> the fattened <WG4618> calf, <WG3448> because <WG3754> he has received <WG618> him back <WG618> safe <WG5198> and sound. <WG5198>'
"But he became angry, <WG3710> and was not willing <WG2309> to go <WG1525> in; and his father <WG3962> came <WG1831> out and [began] entreating <WG3870> him.

"But he answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to his father, <WG3962> 'Look! <WG2400> For so <WG5118> many <WG5118> years <WG2094> I have been serving <WG1398> you, and I have never <WG3763> neglected <WG3928> a command <WG1785> of yours; <WG4771> and [yet] you have never <WG3763> given <WG1325> me a kid, <WG2056> that I might be merry <WG2165> with my friends; <WG5384>

but when <WG3753> this <WG3778> son <WG5207> of yours <WG4771> came, <WG2064> who has devoured <WG2719> your wealth <WG979> with harlots, <WG4204> you killed <WG2380> the fattened <WG4618> calf <WG3448> for him.'
"And he said <WG3004> to him, ['My] child, <WG5043> you have always <WG3842> been <WG1510> with me, and all <WG3956> that is mine <WG1699> is yours. <WG4674>

'But we had <WG1163> to be merry <WG2165> and rejoice, <WG5463> for this <WG3778> brother <WG80> of yours <WG4771> was dead <WG3498> and [has begun] to live, <WG2198> and [was] lost <WG622> and has been found. <WG2147>' "
